title: Ninja Museum + Countryside
content:
This morning we went to a ninja museum before making our way to Kyoto.

The ninja museum is set in a lovely park property with some traditional buildings around as part of the tour experience.

First we were shown and told about various ways ninja would hide themselves and equipment or valuables in all kinds of secret areas of houses. The secret areas, tricks, and hidden mechanisms were all really cool to learn about and see.

Next we wandered through the museum of equipment, garbs, and historical pieces. Learning about the reason for certain things being designed the way they were was really interesting - more than any other exhibition I think the practicality was on display here.

Finally we watched a full-on demonstration of ninja weapon and combat skills. This was fantastic! Genuinely so much training and talent on display with all manner of equipment, each serving a different purpose which was shown. It really was a fun and impressive display!

The drive to lunch at the next rest stop was through some really nice countryside - more very small communities and farm lands.
